Taken from the Federal Railroad Administration's FY2008 safety penalty report obtained through a Freedom of Information Act request. A copy is available upon request.
https://www.fra.dot.gov/Elib/Document/17839

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 212231: Lead Ore and Zinc Ore Mining
Info Source: August 24, 2018 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Info Source: https://www.fra.dot.gov/eLib/Find#p1_z5_lEA

Description: Teck Cominco Alaska Inc. paid $827,000 to settle allegation of environmental violation from an inspection in the fall of 2000 that found 18 potential violations of its air permit, including knowingly operating and failing to properly report equipment that exceeded emission limits and failure to conduct monitoring.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20021008103636/http://www.state.ak.us/local/akpages/ENV.CONSERV/press/2001/rel_1218.htm
